Rules

Moderator:

-I, MattP, am your moderator! I will handle any situations as I see fit.
-Message me with any concerns you have regarding game mechanics, even something as simple as a vote count. The more that can be worked out behind the scenes, the better for everyone!
-Any time you want my attention in-thread, please use bold.
-If rules are broken I have the right to judge if replacement or modkill is needed.
-I may change the rules at any point in the game, although you will be notified.
-Flavour is for the purpose of entertainment only and will not be any indication of role or alignment.

General:

1) Have fun! And allow others to have fun too. Excessive insults or personal attacks will result in a warning or force-replacement.
2) There must be no talking about the game outside this thread, unless using a method allowed by your Role PM.
3) No editing of posts. Ever.
4) No quoting of any PMs or QTs relating to the game.
5) Green is my colour. Don’t use it.
6) Do not discuss ongoing games.
7) Hydras are allowed, but no more than two heads, and they must be PM’d to me.

Gameplay:

8) Votes must be bolded or in vote tag format to count. I will not count any that are not. Example: Vote: MattP Abbreviations can also be used as long as it’s clear who you’re voting for. Example: Vote: MP
9) Unvoting when changing a vote is helpful, but not required. Voting at the beginning of a line is also helpful, but not required.
10) A no-lynch before deadline requires at least half of votes. A lynch always requires a majority of votes.
11) Once a majority is reached, it becomes twilight until I can post the lynch. No voting or unvoting will count.
12) No majority at deadline means no lynch occurs.

Activity:

14) Please inform me if and when you will be V/LA. If I feel the period is too long or there is some other reason for me to do so, I will replace you.
15) Prods will be sent after 2 days (48 hours) without a post. If there is no response after another 24 hours, you will be replaced.
16) If someone accumulates 2 prods over the course of the game and I feel they are not active enough, they will be replaced.
17) Days last 2 weeks unless a lynch occurs before deadline or an extension is granted. Feel free to ask for them, but I will only grant one if it’s deserved.
18) Nights will last 48 hours.

Sample Vanilla Townie Role PM

Welcome, you are a Vanilla Townie.

You win when all threats to the town have been defeated.

During the day you have the ability to post in the game thread and vote.

Please confirm by sending your role to me by PM.


Thank you to DeasVail since I used a large portion of his ruleset.

This post will be unbolded when everyone has received their roles.

The game will begin when 10 of 13 players have confirmed.

12 of 13 players have confirmed! Day 1 begins now! Night will begin in 2 weeks from now

DAY 1 BEGINS NOW

-At this point, BBM is the lead wagon at L-4. (The members are Axxle [received a prod at that time], UN, and Verity.)

-UN points out that RM did not immediately vote fitz. Also asks Fancy Pants to explain the "slow" comments. Calls RM newbscum talking about theory to look good. -Cooldog asks why Trollie is defending UN, and urges people to discard meta.
-BBM clarifies what he meant, and then calls a UN/Trollie scumteam.
-At this point, UN is the lead wagon at L-3 (Slandaar, Cooldog, red, BBM), with RM right behind at L-4 (Trollie, UN, Axxle).

Fancy-Pants Case Summary, Summary: Lurking (both active and passive), refusal to take a stance (waffling) and leaving back doors (backtracking/weasel wording), vocabulary (the "interesting" scumtell), extreme survivalist mentality, extreme parroting of others, and overall lack of town content.

Fancy-Pants Case Augmentation, Summary: RM has been consistently scumhunting since the beginning of the game and doing what a pro-town player should, addressing concerns of other players about his slot and then directing their attention to his suspects. UN has been consistently raising good, solid points and despite his casual playstyle (which goes against his scum meta), asking all the right questions at the right time, making valuable observations. Redtail might seem like he's sheeping, but he backs up his agreement with his own reasoning, augmenting the case rather than simply following it.

Spoiler: As For BBM...
It's a little bit longer, so I want to have it in a separate spoilered post, as to not detract from the summary. When BBM made 299, I decided to take a look at him. And while, yes, his iso does contain a fair amount of trolling, BBM's overall play this game has been incredibly town, which explains the gut townread I had on him. His vote on fitz might have been RVS, but given fitz's post and followup post, when BBM said his vote was a good one, it was already clear he was scumhunting.

Then, when further content comes, he changes his vote to Trollie. Initially, it's without reason, but he explains with very little prompting that Trollie was likely scum for attacking the easy-target, RM (an attack specifically linked to later: post 59). He continues to push his read, and when asked for elaboration, he says "Iso him", basically saying that Trollie should be scummy enough by sight (and when said person doesn't see it, BBM explains what he sees in Trollie). He also pushes Axxle at the same time for being scummy. At this point, BBM was attacking Fancy Pants, an either-or (rather than "both of") between fitz/Trollie, and UN (plus Axxle in said post). Saying that fitz was likely town made it clear the way he was leaning, also giving townreads on Cooldog, red, and RM (saying Slandaar can't be read for a few days as well).

He then elaborates on FP, so I have to take back my statement about BBM not having given a reason. As he said in 299, he did, just said it earlier and didn't vote on it. Meaning, all 5 people on the wagon have given reason, and like the others, BBM has been playing a solid town game. He basically calls a UN/Trollie/FP scumteam, and continues to push it, and when asked, he gives his reasoning for his suspects. BBM's point about the RM wagon being garbage is just one example of why he's been playing a solidly pro-town game.
Beyond that, he showed a willingness to change his read, saying UN might be town, but he wasn't sure, so he continued to apply pressure to figure it out. After this, he votes for Axxle (who was an earlier suspect of his) and then Fancy pants (also a consistent suspect of his, even if he didn't bring it up very often).

Yes, BBM's been trolling. Yes, that's something he does as scum. But his overall content this game points to a solidly pro-town mindset. Not to the same degree as the others, but now that I've gone back and checked BBM's contributions, he's back inside my town-list, rather than my null list. Not as high as the others on it, of course, but CERTAINLY not a day one lynch. His posts haven't been "confusing". Quite the opposite, BBM's posts are some of the more clear ones in the game, because he's kept his overall focus where it needs to be.

@UN: let's go through FP's ISO and examine it piece by piece (which we now have time for; thanks for the extension Mod!).

ISO 0 + ISO 1: RVS. One could maybe argue that the latter was out of RVS, but in that case it's an acceptable reason for voting so early in the day.

ISO 2: This is a really interesting post, and could almost be presented as a textbook case of fence-sitting. He isn't convince of RM's conclusions, but doesn't disagree with the argument. He finds RM's town reads "strange," but chalks it up to being emphatic. I come away having no idea what FP's opinions are. He's not saying anything substantial.

ISO 3: FP says (correctly) that BB's first post is no reason to lynch him. He also says we should be worried about RM. I still have no idea what Fancy Pants thinks about anybody.

ISO 4: There are 4 elements to this post. The first is merely answering a question from Fitz. The second gives a mediocre (but fine for very early game) reason for FP's RVS votes. The third cites RM being "emphatic" as "worrisome." I don't really understand the fourth part, but at least he says that he finds something Robert did "a bit suspicious."

ISO 5: Defends his questioning of RM's reads and says he's not buddying fitz or trollie. He then talks about BB's "trying to link a lot of people together very early in the game," which he finds not scummy, but rather odd. Noted, but I think the way you phrased this makes it quite easy for you to later jump on a BB wagon (or not). Finally, he votes Robert based on RM's WIFOMy question (which, to be fair, was not great). Looking back, one could say he's been kinda building to this, but the biggest hint we've gotten till not is that he found some action of Robert's a bit suspicious. For the record, this was the fourth (and functionally final) vote on the Robert wagon, bringing Robert vs. UN to 4 vs. 4.

ISO 6: Small nothing about a previous assumption, but it's good to note how quickly FP can and does label a previous statement of his as "not a strong assumption."

ISO 7: "He seemed scummy, and that's good enough for now." There is nothing good about that sentence. Really. Also presents his first solid townread of D1 (and his second actual read altogether), although the first line of this post "UN looks town to me" could be taken as a read. Actually, I'll count that. Note: it's on the major opposing wagon of the day so far, and it's a sentiment shared by many in town.

ISO 8: First vote on the FP wagon and he immediately asks for reasons. Unclear whether he knew a wagon would form on him so quickly, but he's very quick to immediately become defensive.

ISO 9: The first half of this has already been deconstructed by mastin. In the second half, FP votes for BB, after previously expressing one of his few actual townreads on precisely that person. Now, obviously stuff happened in between (68 posts to be exact), but he spends very little time talking about this. Instead, he merely notes that he finds BB difficult to read, and concludes that BB is scummy. Actually, he might be concluding that BB is not necessarily scummy, but is anti-town.

ISO 10: But that defense goes down in flames here, where FP solidly says he thinks BB is scummy. He provides no reasoning why difficult to read = scummy.

tldr: FP has consistently avoided giving real information about what he thinks, instead relying on fence-sitting and rhetoric to avoid saying much of anything. There are 3 scenarios:
1. Town vs. Scum
2. Town vs. Town
3. Scum vs. Scum

Case 2: Why didn't scum try to take both or one wagon to L-2 or L-1? Why did scum allow a town vs. town wagon fight to disintegrate like that?

Spoiler: Admit it, this is what 90% of the case against me is made of
I've been debating over whether to do this or not. I hate defending myself, and I hate doing self-meta on myself (for two related reasons. My "eternal newbie" philosophy regarding constantly reinventing myself means that I don't play similarly in any two games, and that--because I constantly seek to change my play--I know my meta better than anyone else, so can theoretically manipulate it, nullifying the point of defending myself with it), but ultimately, the wagon on me isn't entirely scum-driven. One member, sure, two at the most. But there's at least one vote on there which comes from town. And that town vote(s) would best be placed elsewhere.
And a significant part of all three members' cases relies on meta. But I can show 'em wrong.

The difference between my town-self and scum-self is quite simple: conviction. When I'm scum, I have absolute conviction in my reads. When proven wrong, I (as UN describes) shrug it off and continue to attack someone else, with my suspect list undergoing very little modification at all. During my last scum game, I mostly subverted it, because I was trying to out-grow it. However, if you start reading from here-on, you can see that ultimately, I played it straight. It was possible Tammy was scum. It was possible TD was scum, 'til the town lynched TD. Didn't matter. I showed absolute conviction towards Nacho being the last scum. I locked myself into that, and stuck it through.

Compare and contrast, my last town game, where I went into the day absolutely certain I was going to vote (Pine)...
...But I (correctly, as it turned out ) second-guessed myself, and thought, "...waaaaaaaiit a sec...", and thought things through.

Those are both lylos, but the principles apply throughout the game--town-me walls to FIND conviction, but LACKS said conviction to START with. With me alive, something's gone horribly wrong, but I don't know what. Ultimately, my list could end up virtually identical or completely changed, but I re-think things through.
Scum-me walls to SHOW conviction, explaining WHY I believe what I do. My list undergoes minimal changes if it changes at all.

And that's where UN goes wrong. He thinks that I've been showing no hesitation. My hesitation was my walling. The difference is subtle, but it's there.

That's UN taken care of. adorkable's case was that I'm "setting up lynches" and "more aggressive than normal". The first has been disproven by my stances, and the second I've already explained as being a consequence of being a universal townread. Think of it in terms of an innocent child. You're confirmed town--are you going to fade into the background and lurk through the game, or step up, use your towncred, and take control of the town?

Axxle's bit against me is that I post some good points, but the majority is filler-junk. I can tell you right here and now that you can look at any game of mine as any alignment and see the exact same tactics in place. The difference is in the motive, subtle as it may be. As town, I'm either trying to solidify my reads or convince the town of my reads. As scum, I'm either testing the waters or trying to push something through. There's not much of a difference, sure, but it's there to be found.

Yes, this whole defense is meta, but as the title of the spoiler says, so is most of the case against me. There's not really much I can do to counter meta other than bring up meta.

Trying to work out some probabilities, but I'm not very good at 'em.

*One of {Axxle, Pine, Cooldog} is scum, thanks to the "no idea about" list.
*Remaining scum would be in {fitz, RM, UN} thanks to placement.
(Bold = Slandaar's suspicion list.)

-If adorkable is town...
Well, there's no associative tells which can really be gained.

-If there are two scum on the FP lynch...
*It can only be in {RM, Axxle, adorkable}. Refer to scum!dorkable vs. town!dorkable for how that'd distribute things. (Adorkable-town, Axxle+RM. Adorkable-scum, one of Axxle/RM but not both.)

-If there's only one scum on the FP lynch...
*There must be two off, {Pine, fitz, Trollie, | UN}. Again, if adorkable's scum, then it's Pine and probably fitz. If adorkable's town, then it could be any of them, but it'd probably be Pine and fitz, anyway.

-If adorkable and Pine were scum with Axxle, then the "scum not voting RM/UN because of inactivity/presence on wagon already" makes the most sense.
-If one of them and Axxle were scum, it's second-most.
-If neither of them are scum and Axxle is scum, then the scenario doesn't make much sense at all, but neither does the "dual-scum-theory".
-If neither of them are scum and Axxle isn't scum, then the dual-scum-theory makes the most sense.
-If one of them is scum and Axxle isn't scum, then the dual-scum-theory is at its second-strongest.
(This is due to Axxle's presence on the UN wagon. If UN and Axxle were both scum, then RM also being scum doesn't make much sense, as what would make Axxle bus UN over RM?)

Spoiler: long ramblish post
So I asked myself in my sleep (yes, I still dream about mafia) what I really felt about the players. About how, deep down, in my gut, I thought of each of them.

And I'm typing this without access to the site, so I can't double-check my facts. But I like it this way, because...well, in a sense, I feel as if it makes my reads more pure. I know, that's counter-intuitive; it should corrupt my reads rather than make them less diluted, but I just have this feeling that this strategy, of thinking when away from the game, makes the thoughts more valuable.

redtail--Town. If this guy's scum, he quite frankly deserves to win, no matter who his scumbuddies are. When I came in, I thought the possibility of him being scum was there, but...I asked myself "in what scenario is redtail scum?", and I can't come up with anything. 'Guy's the towniest of town players. If he's not town, then he's played so solidly that it'd be scummy-worthy. I just can't see him as scum.

UberNinja--Town. My mind told me that there was a period where I had a brief doubt about him via my gut, thinking "maybe his play here is different from himself-as-town, and maybe it IS similar to his scum-self, and maybe people like redtail doubting him are right", but I asked myself, again and again, "but do I really believe that?" The answer's no. No, I do not. I picture him in my mind. Over and over again, he comes off being town.
The bit of doubt is there (for instance, the thought of him-as-scum knowing that attacking me is a cheap and easy way to gain towncred), but it overwhelmingly still portrays a pro-town picture.

Pine--Town. Yes, I know, this is not something you'd expect from me, but I thought things through. I thought about my case. And I asked myself, in my gut...did I actually believe it? Did I actually believe my case against Pine, that he was once-again scum, playing to his scum meta? And my gut told me the truth: no, I didn't. The case against him wasn't trying to convince the town; the case against him was me trying to convince MYSELF that he was scum, because deep-down, I didn't believe it, and now that I've thought about it, I still don't.

BBMolla--I have a hard time concentrating on BBM in my mind (think of it as having a sort-of static interference), but whenever I do, the conclusion is nearly instantaneous: town. Yes, he's been trollish. Yes, his play's scummy-as-hell. Yes, his play here reminds me a little bit of his scum meta. Yes, I know that if he ends up being scum having trolled the town, I'll have felt ridiculous.
...But despite all of that, I've got this deep-down feeling that he's town. His mannerisms, his way of talking, the words he uses, his contributions to the game, everything he says, everything he does...scummy, yes. But scum? The doubt's there, sure, but I just can't keep a realistic picture of scuMolla in my mind; it keeps on drifting, over and over again, to BBM being town.

Cooldog--Town. I know, I initially called him scummy, due to resemblance to GvE, CvL, but the more I think about it, the more he feels...different. His contributions to the game feel as if they're more significant and have a town motive in them. He brings up a lot more logical points, rather than mostly sheeping. He's less interested in debating with others and seems more focused on scumhunting. All-in-all, he feels like an entirely different guy. If he's scum, then he's completely reinvented his scum-play since the last game we played, in an extremely good way. (If the most-improved scummy is still around, I'd nom him if he's scum; his play is just. that. dang. better.) But I find it far more probable that what I see is what I get: that he's as he appears, town.

Trollie--Surprisingly, I thought of him being town in less than a second. I was like, "Trollie...town!" BAM, that quick. I know, this guy's been overall null for me most of the game, but...I got that gut feeling, a strong gut feeling, that he's town. He's done some questionable things throughout the game, he's made me doubt him at multiple times, but the more I'm thinking about it, the less doubt I have. He gives me reason to pause, but...I can't shake the feeling he's town. And honestly, I'm willing to trust that gut-read.

Now here's where things get tricky. {Axxle, fitz, adorkable, RM}.

adorkable--ambivalent. One moment, I think scum, the next, town. My thoughts stray more and more towards scum, but I can't help but ask myself if that's my biases taking control, or if the feeling's legitimate. When thinking about Venrob, my thoughts definitely lean heavily towards scum, but when thinking about adorkable...their exit from the game and their vote on me both felt...town. adorkable's main post for reads, along with their (lack of) contribution to the game (both before and after) make me question this, but I can't tell. I just can't make a judgment one way or the other.

fitz--scum. I know, difficult call to make. And I'll admit, I'm having a little back-and-forth in my head, but he's more on scum than on town. A few of the things he's said have seemed town, but a lot of what he says seems as if it has a scum motive behind it. I realize I'm not good at reading fitz (I think town when scum, scum when town), but I think one of the key factors in reading him is to look between the lines. I'll admit, a lot of what he does looks as if he has that town motive, but I see at least an equal amount which seems as if it's scum-motivated. There's also who he's been pushing. Making the assumption that everyone in my town-list is town...who outside that list has he pushed? RM? No, he threw some questions at RM, but ultimately avoided that wagon. Axxle? No, same story. adorkable? No, he's twice said in-thread that the slot needed attention (Venrob needed a prod/replacement, adorkable needed a prod/replacement), and while he's urged that slot to give content, he's given no scumread on them.

Axxle--scum. The counterpart to Trollie, in that I thought of him for a split-second, and the result came up as scum instantaneously. Does that mean I have confirmation bias against him? Yes, it most certainly does. Do I think that he's scum, anyway? Also yes. I think about his posts. At every point in the game. I try to think of them as town. I have his ISO virtually memorized because of how many times I've looked at it. And yet, no matter which point in the game I go to, no matter where I stick...Axxle always, ALWAYS looks like scum. I don't see town in him. His posts just feel as if they have a scum motive. I can't think of anything he's done which I thought was town.
The picture paints him as doubtfully being scum with RM, so he does have that in his favor, but I just had the extremely irrational thought of, "what if it were bussing?", and now that I thought of it, I can't shake it off, because he dropped his RM suspicion further on.

Robert Montana--Scum. I made the call almost instantly, and am surprised at the speed I did so. I keep on thinking about his play, and how it initially pinged my scumdar. I keep on thinking about how he sheeped me. I keep on thinking about all the cases against him, and how they strike a chord with me. I keep on thinking about how much I want to believe them. Balanced against what? What, to make him town? Two things. His initial posts remind me of my style when I was a younger player. Combine that, with Slandaar's "bad lynch" part about him.
Yet I got the feeling that Slandaar in his grave is going, "ffs, Mastin, IT WAS A DAY ONE READ!" A point that others have made as well.
And this may or may not be me trying to justify a scum-read on him, but the thought of my posting style having been a null-tell rather than a town-tell comes to mind, since when I did it as a younger player, I had to enforce it as both alignments, lest it become a towntell/scumtell for me to do it/not do it.
I also have a gut feeling that somehow, he's been inconsistent on a player. (BBM?) I don't really remember much else.

Basically, when it comes to RM, a significant part of me is trying to scream out, "HE'S TOWN!", but it's being overwhelmed by an overall feeling of, "shut up, no he isn't", and when I think things through, I can't help but agree.



A tl;dr version is that I can't really see the scum being outside adorkable/fitz/Axxle/RM. My townreads on the other players are just too strong for me to shake. Yes, they're gut reads. Yes, they're not entirely logical. Yes, I can't really explain them, but my feelings are what they are. I just can't shake my view on any of them. Call it confirmation bias, call it stubbornness, call it sheer Mastin idiocy if you'd like, but I simply can't see any of them as scum.

So by POE alone, it has to be one of the four. And on almost all of them, I have conflicting feelings. I know that I'm having tunnel vision on all of them, I know that my suspicions on them aren't rational, and I know one of them is town, but I can't tell who; I just have this overwhelming feeling, that the scumteam's entirely contained within that list.
tl;dr, the scum're still inside {dorkable, fitz, RM, Axxle}.

A full paraphrase of my PM is that I'm a 1-shot doctor who can protect one player in the game during the night, but that it only protects my target from a single kill.
My thought towards being a 1-shot doc during d1 was that there was a JK, and the 1-shot was to prevent the newbie gamebreaking doc-jk combo. My thought towards it protecting from a single kill was that there was a serial killer at first. However, with Slandaar's flip n1, along with AP's softclaim d2, I realized that--rather than there being a SK--it was far more probable that there was a limited-shot vig, as I 'crumbed in 1027. (Read that, and tell me I made that without role-related info implying the presence of the vig.)

Cooldog wrote:1, I would have expected Mastin to claim right then in there because he should have immediately thought "Goddamn I got role blocked!".
Except, that's EXACTLY what I thought, as this post illustrates. I protected Trollie--Trollie died, anyway. My first thought, without reading anything other than that Trollie died, was exactly that: that I was roleblocked.
Then, I began reading what others had posted, and saw Cooldog's claim to have vigged Trollie. And, knowing that my PM specifies I only protect against a single kill, I made the logical conclusion that--rather than me being roleblocked--Trollie was double-killed.

And, really, unless the roleblocker was limited-shot, I don't see one in the setup, for the simple reasoning that all our PRs claimed so far are one-shot. A roleblocker would make the game mountainous.

Also, the wiki is on my side.
A Doctor is a role that targets a player at Night to protect that player from a single kill made during that Night. They are not told if their protection was successful. Protection from a single kill means that if multiple players try to kill someone, they will not be saved by one Doctor's protection.

Doctors are not allowed to self-target. This kind of Doctor, and only this kind of Doctor (ignoring acceptable modifiers), is considered Normal on mafiascum.net.

Claim + 1: UN questions why he wasn't investigated.

Claim + 10: UN calls Claim + 7 scummy
(jump to) Claim + 13: mastin tentatively doesn't buy it

Why is this relevant? Because what fascinated me about this back and forth is how mastin responded to the claim. Let's explore each possibility in turn:

Both are scum: Then mastin's response makes perfect sense. This was quite possibly not planned during the previous night, in which case mastin's confusion is likely genuine and he is working out what to do behind the scenes. Even if it was planned, mastin's posts could easily be him stalling to see what the town thought of the claim. Then he staked a position (although not as strong of one as I would expect).

Both are town: Here we're on shakier ground. First, the reason given by Axxle for waiting to reveal doesn't hold water. He knew there was suspicion of mastin yesterday, and he knew that it would only increase. He had no more PR uses, so he should've come right out and said it. Yes, it lines up mastin for a nightkill, but better he die by nightkill than be mislynched, costing us the game. And he had to know that doing it now would be suspicious. From mastin's side, while he investigates what Axxle said early, he doesn't focus on motivations. I would expect town-mastin to ask himself why scum-axxle would do what he did. But he doesn't; he instead focuses on voting arguments and what Axxle said yesterday. So I can't believe this scenario.

Axxle is scum and mastin is town: Here nothing makes sense. Did Axxle think this maneuver would give him towncred? Why isn't mastin asking himself about Axxle's motivations? Given we're already in mylo, why did Axxle feel the need to upset a very nice applecart? I have nothing here.

UN's Godfather theory: This is actually a bit more stable, but it doesn't fully explain Axxle's actions. We're still stuck with asking why Axxle didn't reveal earlier. The biggest flaw that I find with this theory is how mastin responded to it; he was far too tentative, and I would expect him to have planned for this and come out much more forcefully.

To make a long story short, I'm leaning towards both being scum, although it doesn't answer all questions (notably: why did Axxle feel the need to do this in the first place, and with such monumentally bad timing?).

I still stand by this. The case on me was entirely subjective and illogical. I hammered in point after point after point, to be ignored by everyone.

Okay, so fitz did try to counter a few of my points, but his efforts weren't very convincing.

The case on me being town was as objective as can be, and despite UN's claims to the contrary, I am not that airtight a scum player. I can't fakeclaim worth a damn.

And the cases I had started weren't even addressed. Fitz just pushed them away for there not having been a started Kimor case, but nobody looked at what I DID have. It was looking at my own dang case which was helping me reconvince myself in my scumreads. As I said, had the game not been over when I returned from the weekend, my reads woulda been solidified, at least when it came to UN and probably fitz. (Kimor going after Axxle was actually one of the smartest moves the scumteam could have done, 'cause had it not been for derp-BBM-voting, the scum couldn't hammer me. And it made a lot more sense to go after Axxle than me.)

One weekend can make all the difference between victory and defeat. I was gaining my conviction back over the weekend. I was reconvincing myself that I hadn't gone wrong in calling out the scumteam that I had, that it WAS correct. And had I done so, I would have re-opened my case (I still have that tab open where I was working on it), and hammered in my offense. (My defense was about as rock-solid as I could get.) I would have hammered in all the interactions, all the things Slandaar and Trollie were saying, all things pointing to AP's hide-behind-UN. I would have pointed out their staying on me rather than switching to Axxle more than I already had. (Though that said, UN not switching was smart, since it was one of the main things making me hesitate on calling Axxle town. Ultimately, I would have; see also, how I was reconvincing myself I wasn't wrong and how Axxle had no scum motive for his claim.) How they were desperate to force the lynch through on me.

I have nobody to blame but myself that it took me that long, that by the time I had re-gathered myself, it was too late, though ultimately, with BBM refusing to play the game, and Cooldog not even remotely listening to what I was saying, it almost certainly wouldn't have made a difference. A strong offense does no good if the offense is altogether ignored. I'd already made the more concise points for why they were scum, and those weren't enough; I had already made the concise points for why I wasn't scum, and that wasn't enough, so the strong offense wouldn't have done much, considering how little the strong defense did.

This game is proof of why my belief in NK-analysis is justified, though. When I was a newb, the scum couldn't get away with killing the people largest suspicious of them. Now, as this game proves, they most certainly can. I was right in almost every single point I was making on d3.

All-in-all, I don't really think I coulda done much better than I did. The FP mislynch, while my fault, helped steer me in the right direction. AP's play during the second half of d2 along with Kimor's play at the same time got me where I needed to be, getting RM out of my scumlist, getting AP out of my scumlist, and putting in their place the (correct!) Kimor-UN scumteam. With fitz in both. (And Axxle, since Axxle played a lot like I'd expect scum to, and he had plenty of interactions with the other three. It wasn't 'til d3 that I had any reason to think him town.)

So really, it was AP who I owed the most to. He turned me from thinking him and RM to be scum, into where I needed to go. It's just that it wasn't enough, because I didn't drive it hard enough. Guess that's my largest mistake this game: I never went hard enough. I pushed, and I pushed hard, but I didn't push as much as I needed to push. All the scum were off the d1 lynch; I felt it, and I needed to push that. All the scum were ON the d2 lynch; I knew it, and that lynch was horrendously scumdriven, but I didn't push it hard enough. The push on d3 was horribly scumdriven, yet I didn't hammer that home hard enough. I can't really say, though, that if I were to play this game again, I'd do so differently.

In this game, me not having conviction was a weakness for the latter half. However, the first half of the game is proof of why having conviction isn't always a good idea, since my absolute belief in FP got an all-town mislynch d1, and my absolute belief in AP-RM could have easily cost the town the game. Hence, why I don't think I'd do this game much differently than I did.

Guess this just means that I need to change my approach. Be willing to change early-on and solidify myself later-on, rather than solidifying myself early-on only to doubt myself later-on. So maybe that's what I'd have done differently. It's a good learning exercise, though, and I've got a few MD posts to make about this game.
